Input folder and file name or file name pattern such as 'VTN_N_ALL_INV/SOS*.xlsx' (to process multiple files using the same configuration).
You can skip the two config parameters below related to input folder and file if you run the program like as follow:
E.g., >> python transform.py -c configs/common_qa_config.json -i ./path/to/input/file/input_data_file.xlsx
(Optional) Enter the sheet name of the input Excel file to read data from. Default is the first sheet.
(Optional) Boolean flag telling if we should write data to a destination place. Default is always True.
(Optional) Enter the sheet name of the output Excel file. Default is 'Sheet1'.
(Optional) Relative path of output folder if the data is going to be written to a file. Default is going to be the current working directory of transform.py
Default is going to be the current working directory of transform.py
(Optional) Prefix for the output file name.
(Required if there's header row in your data) Enter the row index (>= 0) to extract column headers from. E.g., if column header row is the first row, enter 0 below.
If this value is NOT provided, the program will assume there is no header row in the input file.
(Optional) Specify the row index (>= 0) where the data, *not including the column headers*, begins.
Default is 1 (the second row) because that's where the data usually begins in files (the first row is almost always the column headers).
(Optional) Number of rows (>=1) to drop/ignore from the bottom of the data file.
Default is 0, meaning ever row of data will be read, including the last line in the file.
Also, make to define the rows_per_read value such that the rows at the bottom to drop (skipfooter value below) are NOT read in two different iterations/chunks.
If that happens, then the skipfooter will not correctly drop the right number of rows at the bottom.
(Optional) Path+name of that has **CUSTOM** functions for data transformation, which will be imported and used in the transform process.
(Required) List of the functions and their parameters.
These functions must be defined either in transform_functions.py or individual task's transform file such as ./transform_function/aed_gcc_transform_functions.py
